見.definition: to appear; also written 現|现[xian4]

見不得.definition: not fit to be seen by; should not be exposed to; can't bear to see

見世面.definition: to see the world; to broaden one's horizons

見人說人話，見鬼說鬼話.pinyin: jiàn rén shuō rén huà ， jiàn guǐ shuō guǐ huà
見人說人話，見鬼說鬼話.definition: (fig.) adaptable; able to deal with various kinds of people and situations; (derog.) insincere; two-faced

見光死.definition: (lit.) to wither in the light of day; (fig.) the bubble bursts as the reality becomes apparent (esp. of a much-anticipated first meeting with sb); (of stocks) just as the favorable news is officially published, the stock price falls

見利忘義.definition: lit. to see profit and forget morality (idiom); fig. to act from mercenary considerations; to sell one's soul

見利思義.definition: to see profit and remember morality (idiom); to act ethically; not tempted by riches

見報.definition: to appear in the news; in the papers

見外.definition: to treat sb with the formal courtesy accorded to a host or a guest

見好就收.definition: (idiom) to quit while one is ahead; to know when to stop

見得.definition: to seem; to appear; (in a negative or interrogative sentence) to be sure

見微知著.definition: (idiom) to examine tiny clues to know general trends; to deduce the whole story from small traces

見怪不怪.definition: to have seen sth so often that it doesn't seem strange at all; to be well accustomed (to sth)

見愛.definition: (literary) to be so good as to show favor (to me); to regard (me) highly

見招拆招.definition: to counter every move; to be full of tricks

見教.definition: I have been enlightened by your teaching (humble)

見方.definition: (measurement) (after a length) square (as in "10 feet square")

見景生情.definition: to be touched by a scene; to adapt to the situation

見機行事.definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances; to play it by ear; to use one's discretion

見獵心喜.definition: lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom); fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again

見異思遷.definition: to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty; never satisfied with what one has

見票即付.definition: payable at sight; payable to bearer

見笑.definition: to mock; to be ridiculed; to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)

見紅.definition: (coll.) to bleed (esp. vaginal bleeding); to suffer a financial loss

見縫就鑽.definition: lit. to squeeze into every crack (idiom); fig. to make the most of every opportunity

見縫插針.definition: lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch

見義勇為.definition: to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth; acting heroically in a just cause

見習.definition: to learn on the job; to be on probation

見聞.definition: what one has seen and heard; knowledge; one's experience

見背.definition: (formal, tactful) (of an elder) to pass away

見色忘友.definition: to neglect one's friends when smitten with a new love

見色忘義.definition: to forget loyalty when in love; hoes before bros

見訪.definition: your visit (honorific); you honor me with your visit

見諸行動.definition: to translate sth into action; to put sth into action

見證.definition: to be witness to; witness; evidence

見證人.definition: eyewitness (to an incident); witness (to a legal transaction)

見識.definition: to gain first-hand knowledge of sth; to experience for oneself; knowledge; experience; insight

見賢思齊.definition: see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous; Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.

見錢眼開.definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain; money-grubbing

見長.definition: to excel at (typically used after the area of expertise) (Example: 以研究見長|以研究见长[yi3 yan2jiu1 jian4chang2] to be known for one's research)

見閻王.definition: (coll.) to meet one's maker; to kick the bucket; to die

見難而上.definition: to take the bull by the horns (idiom)

見面.definition: to meet; to see each other; CL:次[ci4]

見面禮.definition: gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time

見風使帆.definition: lit. see the wind and set your sails (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically; to be flexible and take advantage of the situation

見風使舵.definition: lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically; to be flexible and take advantage of the situation

見風是雨.definition: lit. see the wind and assume it will rain (idiom); fig. gullible; to believe whatever people suggest

見風轉舵.definition: lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically; to be flexible and take advantage of the situation

見馬克思.definition: to die; lit. to visit Marx; to pass away

見駕.definition: to have an audience (with the emperor)

見鬼.definition: absurd; strange; (interj.) curse it!; to hell with it!
